00027 #ifndef _KD_TREE_SSE_24D_H_
00028 #define _KD_TREE_SSE_24D_H_
00029 
00030 // Includes for the SSE instruction set and aligned memory allocation
00031 #include <xmmintrin.h>
00032 #include <malloc.h>
00033 
00034 // Include the kd-tree template
00035 #include "kd-tree.h"
00036 
00044 template <>
00045 void *feature_vector<float, 24U>::operator new [] (size_t size) {
00046 
00047         // Allocate memory aligned to 16 bytes
00048         void *p = memalign(16, size);
00049         
00050         // Throw an allocation exception in case of error
00051         if(p == NULL) {
00052                 std::bad_alloc exception;
00053                 throw exception;
00054         }
00055 
00056         return p;
00057 }
00058 
00067 template <>
00068 float feature_vector<float, 24U>::distance_to(const feature_vector<float, 24U> &p) const {
00069 
00070         // Set data pointers as SSE vectors. Let's say each is composed of 6 4-float vectors: A B C D E F.
00071         __m128 *this_data = (__m128 *) data;
00072         __m128 *p_data = (__m128 *) p.data;
00073 
00074         // Required SSE registers
00075         __m128 sqr1, sqr2, acc1, acc2;
00076 
00077         // Calculate acc1 = dist(A + B)
00078         sqr1 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[0], p_data[0]);
00079         sqr2 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[1], p_data[1]);
00080         sqr1 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr1, sqr1);
00081         sqr2 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr2, sqr2);
00082         acc1 = _mm_add_ps(sqr1, sqr2);
00083 
00084         // Calculate acc2 = dist(C + D)
00085         sqr1 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[2], p_data[2]);
00086         sqr2 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[3], p_data[3]);
00087         sqr1 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr1, sqr1);
00088         sqr2 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr2, sqr2);
00089         acc2 = _mm_add_ps(sqr1, sqr2);
00090 
00091         // Accumulate acc1 += acc2 (acc1 contains A + B + C + D)
00092         acc1 = _mm_add_ps(acc1, acc2);
00093         
00094         // Calculate acc2 = dist(E + F)
00095         sqr1 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[4], p_data[4]);
00096         sqr2 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[5], p_data[5]);
00097         sqr1 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr1, sqr1);
00098         sqr2 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr2, sqr2);
00099         acc2 = _mm_add_ps(sqr1, sqr2);
00100 
00101         // Accumulate acc1 += acc2 (acc1 contains A + B + C + D + E + F)
00102         acc1 = _mm_add_ps(acc1, acc2);
00103         
00104         // Return the sum of the 4 acc1 elements
00105         const float *f = (const float *) &acc1;
00106         return f[0] + f[1] + f[2] + f[3];
00107 }
00108 
00119 template <>
00120 float feature_vector<float, 24U>::distance_to(const feature_vector<float, 24U> &p, float upper) const {
00121 
00122         // Set data pointers as SSE vectors. Let's say each is composed of 6 4-float vectors: A B C D E F.
00123         __m128 *this_data = (__m128 *) data;
00124         __m128 *p_data = (__m128 *) p.data;
00125         
00126         // Required SSE registers
00127         __m128 sqr1, sqr2, acc1, acc2;
00128 
00129         // Calculate acc1 = dist(A + B)
00130         sqr1 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[0], p_data[0]);
00131         sqr2 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[1], p_data[1]);
00132         sqr1 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr1, sqr1);
00133         sqr2 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr2, sqr2);
00134         acc1 = _mm_add_ps(sqr1, sqr2);
00135 
00136         // Calculate acc2 = dist(C + D)
00137         sqr1 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[2], p_data[2]);
00138         sqr2 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[3], p_data[3]);
00139         sqr1 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr1, sqr1);
00140         sqr2 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr2, sqr2);
00141         acc2 = _mm_add_ps(sqr1, sqr2);
00142 
00143         // Accumulate acc1 += acc2 (acc1 contains A + B + C + D)
00144         acc1 = _mm_add_ps(acc1, acc2);
00145         
00146         // Check upper bound
00147         const float *f = (const float *) &acc1;
00148         float partial_acc = f[0] + f[1] + f[2];
00149         if(partial_acc > upper) return partial_acc;
00150 
00151         // Calculate acc2 = dist(E + F)
00152         sqr1 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[4], p_data[4]);
00153         sqr2 = _mm_sub_ps(this_data[5], p_data[5]);
00154         sqr1 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr1, sqr1);
00155         sqr2 = _mm_mul_ps(sqr2, sqr2);
00156         acc2 = _mm_add_ps(sqr1, sqr2);
00157 
00158         // Accumulate acc1 += acc2 (acc1 contains A + B + C + D + E + F)
00159         acc1 = _mm_add_ps(acc1, acc2);
00160 
00161         // Return the sum of the 4 acc1 elements
00162         return f[0] + f[1] + f[2] + f[3];
00163 }

00165 #endif
